intro: Galium incanum subsp. elatius, commonly known as the silverweed or woolly bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its stems are often prostrate or ascending, with opposite leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks.
